07/02/25.title: Viewer & Story Alpha
content: If you're reading this right now, it's for only one of two reasons: either you're one of my trusted friends or family that I've decided to share this with, or you've randomly discovered this and you're early to the show. But either way, I want to thank you for being here and supporting my work.

PARAGATE is the second novel I've written; one that is far more personal to me. The two main characters are manifestations of anxiety and major depression that closely resemble my own struggles with these battles, and I look forward to telling you a story about what I've learned in "fighting the good fight" against both of them.

This is an early release of the story, so not everything is entirely nailed down yet — but it's certainly planned. That being said, if it's posted here, it's in polished enough of a form that I'm confident to post it.

If you enjoy this work, please let me know on social media, and feel free to share it with others. I'm still figuring out this self-publishing thing (and trying to spend more of my time writing than improving this Javascript applet).
Thanks again for your support.
With love,
Savant-Guarde :)

content: Finished the split prologue for PARAGATE. Was pretty tough to make the damn thing read across and down most of the time, like a word puzzle or something.

10/11/25.title: Story Restructure
content: Hey there!
If you're actually reading this, not only am I surprised, but I'm very thankful for your support.

As you might guess, Paragate is still in a preliminary state. Over the course of the last few months, I've decided to restructure the story's order to make it more compelling out of the gate: with an 'in medias res' opening.
I've also made loads of progress on the story: already halfway into the third act of four, with everything planned out.

Can't tell you how excited I am to share this story with you. And if you're reading this, and I actually have readers out there, reach out to me on <a href='https://bsky.app/profile/savant-guarde.bsky.social'> BlueSky <a>, or send me a message on Discord @SavantGuarde#8032 :)
Thanks again for your support!
With love,
Savant-Guarde :)

12/26/25.title: Viewer Beta
content: The first public beta of my new Story Viewer is live—built to read and browse both Firebrand and Paragate in a cleaner, faster format.
Also: Paragate is in the home stretch. The draft is nearly complete, and I'm shifting focus toward final polish, continuity checks, and release prep.
What to expect in the beta

• Quick navigation by act / chapter / scene
  • Clean reading mode (built for long sessions)
  • Fast search + structured indexing (so you can actually find things)
Beta note: You may run into rough edges—formatting quirks, missing polish, or the occasional odd behavior. If you spot anything broken or confusing, I want to hear about it.
With love,
Savant-Guarde :)

07/02/25.title: Viewer & Story Beta
content: If you're reading this right now, it's for only one of two reasons: either you're one of my trusted friends or family that I've decided to share this with, or you've randomly discovered this and you're early to the show. But either way, I want to thank you for being here and supporting my work.

FIREBRAND is the first novel I've ever written. I wrote the bulk of this during a rough time of my life, when I was going to college in a different state: starting entirely from zero and not knowing anyone; allowing loneliness and unmedicated depression to lead me into a long spiral.

But I came out the other side and I survived, making it through the long quarters of my engineering program. The concept of a continuous fight without an end in sight provided the fuel for the thesis of this story: 'If you had an unlimited number of attempts to rewrite the past, would it break you, or would you find peace'? It also inspired the main character Titus: a suffer-it-alone kind of guy that was a lot like me before I learned my lesson, figuring out how to sincerely open up to people.

This is an early release of the story, but the full story is entirely written: just being progressively edited. But, rest assured, if it's posted here, it's in polished enough a form that I'm confident to post it.

If you enjoy this work, please let me know on social media and feel free to share it with others. I'm still figuring out this self-publishing thing (and trying to spend more of my time writing than improving this Javascript applet).
Thanks again for your support.
With love,
Savant-Guarde :)
